page.title: 01ORPHIR
page.content: This area of Orphir is very hilly with a rough moorland covering. This included the summit of Ward Hill which is the highest hill on the mainland of Orkney. The southern side of the hill is used by Territorial Army as a training ground and rifle range. There are also peat banks on the hillside which are still worked. Below the hills is Orphir Village, this is a group of small holdings and private houses centred around the church. The area around the village is intensively farmed grassland for cattle and sheep.
